name: 4-n-hexyloxyphenol
Reason: 4-n-hexyloxyphenol has a melting point that we can compare to benzene's melting point of 5.5°C. The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a hexyl group and an oxo group. The hexyl group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The oxo group introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +10°C.
